I think I'm going to start by calling our local United Way office tomorrow - I actually drive past it on my way to work every day and never thought about volunteering there. And maybe I'll look into what the CFP coursework actually involves. 

But I'm realizing I should probably have a conversation with my wife about all this too. She's been supportive when I've complained about work, but we've never really talked seriously about me changing careers. I'm a little nervous about bringing it up because she might worry about the financial implications just like I have been.

How do you think I should approach that conversation? I don't want to freak her out, but I also don't want to make major decisions without her input. Should I wait until I've explored the volunteer opportunities first, or is this something I should discuss with her right away?

And I guess I'm also wondering - am I being realistic about this, or am I just having some kind of mid-life crisis? How do you know when career dissatisfaction is worth acting on versus just something you need to accept as part of adult life?

<END>
